content: Thunderbird is offered free and always has been. That image is just a reminder that Thunderbird is dependent on the generosity of its users. If you do not wish to be reminded of that, just go to settings>general and untick the start page.

content: Attachments to received messages can be attached to new messages by drag and drop.
creator: sfhowes

content: Run Windows in safe mode to bypass Norton and the VPN at startup. If you keep Norton in Windows normal mode, you'll have to disable its scanning of the TB profile and also scanning of secure connections. Things would be a lot simpler if you replaced Norton with Windows Security.
creator: sfhowes

content: It's usually due to a corrupted file. Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete or rename session.json, restart TB a few times and see if tabs open at exit are open at next restart.
creator: sfhowes

content: - first, make sure that you accept cookies at settings>privacy&security - in creating the account, I suggest NOT entering password during setup, but wait until prompted for it by Google.

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste di supporto:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

Non ti trattiene nessuno :)

Se invece vuoi delle risposte più pertinenti aggiunge informazioni e dettagli:

  1. Contenuto del messaggio relativo al crash
  2. Versione di Thunderbird
  3. Versione del sistema operativo
  4. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  5. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)

p.s. i log vengono inviati direttamente agli sviluppatori, questo invece è solo un forum per gli utenti.

content: Above the message list pane is the button for 'Quick Filter' . To its right is a small icon, Click that and click the 'sort by' which lets you select 'date' and also 'unthreaded' or 'threaded' . If you do not see that, click view>layout>message list header from menu bar. If you do not see the menu bar, click the alt key.
creator: davidsk

content: It depends: If the messages have been deleted, they're likely gone. If you had moved profile from one PC to another, there are possibilities. If you deleted and reinstalled Thunderbird, it depends on how thoroughly you did the uninstall. Please share some info on your situation. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
If it's just one folder, click view>sort by and tick 'unthreaded.' For more complete control, see this:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

content: I thought I had posted a reply but it doesn't seem to have been saved. So what I said was - you are brilliant David and thank you so much. It was such a simple fix (your first suggestion did the trick). I am happier about continuing to use Thunderbird - although the 'clumping' of emails (threads) I find annoying. Is there a way to go back to how it used to be?
creator: Keryn

content:
Well, with flattery like that, I am obligated to answer the next question... :)

Threading has been in Thunderbird since 2022 and ver 102. To many, it's a curse.

Here is my own documentation on threading, duplicating the above, but it may help: You need to highlight each folder and click View>sort by>unthreaded. If this applies to just a few folders, just repeat the process as necessary. If you have many folders or plan to add many new folders, you may wish a different approach, below: 

More info:  To change default for new folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags      0 =unthreaded    Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right.    ------------ 	 These steps may also help:  To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: This must be done on an account by account basis. # select table view  - the icon just to right of 'quick filter' button above message list pane #  select a message folder and apply all desired attributes - View>sort by from menu bar (if not shown, click alt key) #  click the icon at right side of column display in message list pane #  select the entry near bottom 'Apply current view to...' #  highlight 'folder and children' # move mouse left to see account name and move left again to display all account folders. Now CLICK. a small menu will appear to confirm setting all folders within that account.  I did a simple (okay, crude) video at https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4
creator: davidsk

content: This is going to take me a bit longer to read and 'digest'. I will have a go when I have more time and let you know how I got on. Thank you again for the help offered! It is 17.20 here! Actually - I am not sure what you mean by a folder - such is my ignorance. The emails clump when something decides the emails are following a theme or are a string of replies. So I want to apply it so that the emails come in separately and stay in date order. I'll leave it there for now.
creator: Keryn

content: A 'folder' example would be inbox, sent, draft, trash, etc. For a few folders, just highlight each, click view>sort by> and tick unthreaded. Do that for each folder. My longer post would be useful if you have many folders or plan to add many.
creator: davidsk

content: And it works!! I shall pass that one on to a friend who I know is similarly irritated by the threads! Thank you so much.
creator: Keryn

content: I do not understand your intent. Setting up Thunderbird to be your agent for an account is to authorize Thunderbird to retrieve messages from the account. IMAP automatically sync's the account for you. You could go offline as an option. Possibly, with more information on your intent, some ideas my be forthcoming. thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
In genere Thunderbird usa solo l'ultimo dei file "duplicati". Nel tuo caso ad esempio INBOX-21 e non quelli precedenti. Ma non è una regola ferrea. Se vuoi provare ad eliminarli, fai prima un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo in modo da poter ripristinare la situazione in caso di necessità. Non cancellare i file mfs.

Ovviamente il problema resta capire perché la compattazione si blocchi. Potrebbe dipendere da software di terze parti che interferiscono con i file di Thunderbird (p.e. un antivirus). O più semplicemente la dimensione dei file è eccessiva. Hai una cartella INBOX abbondantemente sopra il GB.
creator: @next

content:
Grazie della celere risposta.

In realtà su questo Account i file INBOX arrivano fino ad INBOX-90

Se vado ad analizzare l'ultima modifica del file noto che INBOX ultima modifica 13/11/24 ore 16:19 (poco fa) INBOX-90 ultima modifica 13/11/24 11:16 INBOX-89 ultima modifica 07/11/24 20:42 .... E tutti gli altri hanno data ultima modifica antecedente.

A questo punto mi viene da pensare che il file "corretto" contenente l'archivio messaggi sia INBOX
creator: pezzullocarmine

content: Nel dubbio lascia il primo e l'ultimo. Al limite ripristini tutto con backup.
creator: @next

content:
Posso procedere in questo senso. Peccato però che la mia cartella "Profilo" è 223GB (in seguito a tutta questa moltitudine di duplicati presenti su tutti i profili)

Posso pensare di eliminare tutti i file duplicati INBOX e tenere solo il primo e l'ultimo Fare Backup Vedere quale file successivamente è oggetto di modifica ed eliminare l'altro.

Una volta risolto andrebbe capito poi perchè si presente questo problema (soprattutto con Gmail)
creator: pezzullocarmine

content: Try this:: - incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (assuming IMAP) - outgoing: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2
creator: davidsk

content: I can't advise on password, but a reminder on server settings: - incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (assuming IMAP) - outgoing: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2

content:
Are you using Owl for Exchange access?

Version 1.3.4 Released Nov. 12, 2024 334.9 KiB Works with Thunderbird 115.0 - 128.*

Hotfix Fixes message content being blank in TB 128.4.3, which broke one of the internal APIs in bug 1924291
creator: sfhowes

content:
I am using Owl for Exchange and keep it updated. I'll check out Hotfix, thanks.

Update: I reinstalled 128.4.1 but it wouldn't find the profile. I eventually figured that out, but then every time I opened the app, it was broken again. So I checked and it was back to 128.4.3. Deleting that version didn't help. So I tried once more, but installed it on my desktop instead of the applications folder, used about:profile to force it to see the correct profile. So far, it's working again, as long as I keep it on my desktop. Not a perfect solution but it'll do for now.
creator: BSmitty

content: leave the password NOT entered. wait until prompted. Also, make sure you accept cookies at settings>privacy&security
creator: davidsk

content: If you copied the mbox into Mail/Local Folders in the profile, and the folder appeared under Local Folders in the Folder Pane when TB was restarted, you should be able to search the folder by selecting it and then invoking Classic Search (Ctrl+Shift+F).
creator: sfhowes
